intro: Symbolanthus elisabethae subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western symbolanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
